name: "True Blood" The Pilot Quiz | True Blood | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the store that the couple stopped at in the opening moments?
questions.explanation:
Grab it Quick.

	There was a sign out front noting the store sold Tru Blood with a few of the letters in red. The young man in the car declared they had to stop in. The clerk was watching a news program with a vampire on it being interviewed. The couple was informed by the store clerk that New Orleans was a mecca for vampires.

questions.text: Was the store clerk in the opening scenes of the episode a vampire?
questions.explanation:
No.

	He pretended to be a vampire in order to scare the young, slightly drunk, couple who stopped in asking questions. The customer in line behind them however was a vampire. He scared the couple out of the store, then threatened to kill the clerk if he ever pretended to be a vampire again.

questions.text: Oscar winning actress Anna Paquin played lead character Sookie Stackhouse. What made Sookie special?
questions.explanation:
She was a telepath.

	Sookie called her condition a "disability" and the townsfolk thought she was spooky because of it. Those who believed she had the ability that is. Sookie's best friend was Tara and she fell for a vampire suitor during the opening episodes of the series.

questions.text: What was the name of the vampire that wandered into Sookie's place of work?
questions.explanation:
Bill.

	He wandered into Merlotte's while Sookie was talking with Tara and Sam (her boss) at the bar. He sat in Sookie's section and ordered a synthetic blood. The bar didn't have any in stock, as he was the first vampire to ever come into the bar. Instead he ordered a glass of red wine.

questions.text: Jason Stackhouse, Sookie's brother, was introduced while having sex with a woman. What happened to that woman sometime after he left?
options: She called the police and claimed he raped her.
Her husband came home and found out she was unfaithful.
She was attacked by a vampire.
questions.explanation:
She was murdered.

	The woman, Maudette Pickens, was found murdered the next day after Jason had been with her. He was arrested for the murder after a tape of his encounter from the night before was found by police.

questions.text: Who were the Descendants of the Glorious Dead?
options: Descendants of people who signed the Constitution.
A group trying to kill vampires.
questions.explanation:
Civil War descendants.

	The Descendants of the Glorious Dead was a group that Sookie's grandmother Adele was a member of. It was mostly the elderly in the community, all somehow related soldiers who died in the Civil War. Bill Compton, the vampire, was a former Civil War soldier who fought for the south.

questions.text: How long had vampires been known to the world when the show debuted?
questions.explanation:
2 years.

	Vampires had revealed themselves to the world about 2 years prior to the pilot episode, but they still weren't widely accepted in all facets of culture. In rural Louisiana where the show was set, Bill was the first known vampire to wander through Renard Parish. People still stood on both sides of the fence in regards to where they stood on vampire rights and other issues.

questions.text: In the first scene to feature Adele Stackhouse, she was reading a book by what author?
questions.explanation:
Charlaine Harris.

	Harris was the author of the "Southern Vampire Mysteries" which were the books that the show was based on. The book that Adele was reading was called "Last Scene Alive" and was part of the "Aurora Teagarden Mystery" series.

questions.text: All of Sookie's friends and family thought dating Bill was a good idea.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Adele Stackhouse was thrilled by the idea of Bill, but hadn't weighed in on the possibility of them as a couple by the end of the pilot. Tara, and others at the bar, thought Bill was bad for her and worried for Sookie's safety. Sookie herself didn't care what the others thought, instead she seemed happy that she couldn't read his mind, unlike all of the other people in town.

questions.text: Who attacked Sookie at the end of the pilot?
questions.explanation:
Mack and Denise Rattray.

	The couple had vowed revenge on Sookie for stopping them from draining all the blood out of Bill the night they met him. A couple nights later, they waited for her outside of the bar and attacked when she left after work.
